sen.j: 大宝律令（たいほうりつりょう）は、8世紀初頭に制定された日本の律令である。
sen.e: Taiho Ritsuryo refers to the Japanese Ritsuryo codes established in the beginning of the eighth century.
Taiho Ritsuryo refers to the Japanese Ritsuryo codes established in the beginning of the eighth century.
Taiho Ritsuryo refers to the Japanese Ritsuryo codes established in the beginning of the eighth century.

sen.j: 唐の永徽律令（えいきりつれい、651年制定）を参考にしたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is believed that Eiki Ritsuryo (the Ritsuryo code that was established in Tang Dynasty) of Tang was referred to.
It is believed that Eiki Ritsurei (the Ritsuryo code that was established in Tang Dynasty in 651) of Tang was referred to.
sen.cmt: Ritsuryo→Ritsurei と修正しました。（オリジナルに従ったのと、”りつれい”での使用が見られるため）「651年」を補いました。
sen.e: It is believed that Eiki Ritsurei (the Ritsuryo code that was established in Tang Dynasty in 651) of Tang was referred to.

sen.j: 大宝律令は、日本史上初めて律と令がそろって成立した本格的な律令である。
sen.e: Taiho Ritsuryo was the first and full-fledged Ritsuryo codes in the Japanese history which were formed by containing both Ritsu (criminal code) and Ryo (administrative code).
Taiho Ritsuryo were the first full-fledged Ritsuryo codes in the Japanese history, which Ritsu (criminal code) and Ryo (administrative code) were both contained.
sen.cmt: 文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Taiho Ritsuryo were the first full-fledged Ritsuryo codes in the Japanese history, which Ritsu (criminal code) and Ryo (administrative code) were both contained.

sen.j: 大宝律令に至る律令編纂の起源は681年まで遡る。
sen.e: The compilation of Ritsuryo codes leading to the Taiho Ritsuryo dates back to the year 681.
The origin of the compilation of Ritsuryo codes leading to the Taiho Ritsuryo dates back to the year 681.
sen.cmt: The origin of を補いました。
sen.e: The origin of the compilation of Ritsuryo codes leading to the Taiho Ritsuryo dates back to the year 681.

sen.j: 同年、天武天皇により律令制定を命ずる詔が発令され、天武没後の689年（持統3年6月）に飛鳥浄御原令が頒布・制定された。
sen.e: In the same year, the Emperor Tenmu issued Mikotonori (imperial edict) ordering the establishment of Ritsuryo codes, and in 689 after the Emperor Tenmu died, Asukakiyomihararyo (the legal code of Japanese ancient state) was distributed and established.

In the same year, the Emperor Tenmu issued Mikotonori (imperial edict) ordering the establishment of Ritsuryo codes, and in 689 after the Emperor Tenmu died, Asukakiyomihararyo (the legal code of Japanese ancient state) was distributed and established.

In the same year, the Emperor Tenmu issued Mikotonori (imperial edict) ordering the establishment of Ritsuryo codes, and in 689 after the Emperor Tenmu died, Asukakiyomihararyo (the legal code of Japanese ancient state) was distributed and established.

sen.j: ただし、この令は先駆的な律令法であり、律を伴っておらず、また日本の国情に適合しない部分も多くあった。
sen.e: However, such Ryo was a pioneering Ritsuryo law, contained no Ritsu, and did not conform to the state of affairs in Japan in many parts.
However, such Ryo was a pioneering Ritsuryo law, contained no Ritsu, and did not conform to the state of affairs in Japan in many parts.
However, such Ryo was a pioneering Ritsuryo law, contained no Ritsu, and did not conform to the state of affairs in Japan in many parts.

sen.j: その後も律令編纂の作業が続けられ、特に日本の国情へいかに適合させるかが大きな課題とされていた。
sen.e: The work of compiling the Ritsuryo codes was also continued after that, and an especially big issue was how to conform to the conditions of a country of Japan.
The work of compiling the Ritsuryo codes was also continued after that, and a particularly big issue was how to conform to the conditions of a country of Japan.
sen.cmt: an especially→a particularly と修正しました。
sen.e: The work of compiling the Ritsuryo codes was also continued after that, and a particularly big issue was how to conform to the conditions of a country of Japan.

sen.j: そして、700年（文武4年）に令がほぼ完成し、残った律の条文作成が行われ、701年（大宝 (日本)元年8月3日 (旧暦)）、大宝律令として完成した。
sen.e: And in 700, Ryo was almost completed, and the work to create uncreated articles of Ritsu was conducted, and then, on September 13, 701, the Ritsuryo codes were completed as Taiho Ritsuryo.
And in 700, Ryo was almost completed, and the work to create uncreated articles of Ritsu was conducted, and then, on September 13, 701, the Ritsuryo codes were completed as Taiho Ritsuryo.
And in 700, Ryo was almost completed, and the work to create uncreated articles of Ritsu was conducted, and then, on September 13, 701, the Ritsuryo codes were completed as Taiho Ritsuryo.

sen.j: 律令選定に携わったのは、忍壁皇子・藤原不比等・粟田真人・下毛野古麻呂らである。
sen.e: Osakabe no Miko (Prince Osakabe), FUJIWARA no Fuhito, AWATA no Mahito, SHIMOTUKENU no Komaro were engaged in the selection of Ritsu and Ryo.
Osakabe no Miko (Prince Osakabe), FUJIWARA no Fuhito, AWATA no Mahito, SHIMOTUKENU no Komaro were engaged in the selection of the Ritsu and Ryo.
Osakabe no Miko (Prince Osakabe), FUJIWARA no Fuhito, AWATA no Mahito, SHIMOTUKENU no Komaro were engaged in the selection of the Ritsu and Ryo.

sen.j: 大宝律令を全国一律に施行するため、同年（大宝元年8月8日）、朝廷は明法博士を西海道以外の6道に派遣して、新令を講義させた。
sen.e: In order to enforce Taiho Ritsuryo across the country without exception, on September 18, 701, the imperial court dispatched Myobo hakase (teacher of the law in the Ritsuryo system) to six Do (districts) except for Saikaido, and caused such hakase to lecture the new codes.

In order to enforce the Taiho Ritsuryo across the country without exception, on September 18, 701, the imperial court dispatched the Myobo hakase (teacher of the law in the Ritsuryo system) to six Do (districts) except for Saikaido, and let them lecture on the new codes.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。caused→let,such hakase→themto lecture→lecture on と修正しました。
sen.e: In order to enforce the Taiho Ritsuryo across the country without exception, on September 18, 701, the imperial court dispatched the Myobo hakase (teacher of the law in the Ritsuryo system) to six Do (districts) except for Saikaido, and let them lecture on the new codes.

sen.j: 翌702年（大宝2年2月1日 (旧暦)）、文武天皇は大宝律を諸国へ頒布し、10月14日 (旧暦)には大宝律令を諸国に頒布した。
sen.e: On March 7, 702, the Emperor Monmu distributed Taiho Ritsu to provinces, and on November 12, 702, he distributed Taiho Ritsuryo to provinces.
On March 7, the following 702, the Emperor Monmu distributed Taiho Ritsu to those provinces, and on November 12, 702, he distributed Taiho Ritsuryo to the provinces.
sen.cmt: the following, those, the を補いました。
sen.e: On March 7, the following 702, the Emperor Monmu distributed Taiho Ritsu to those provinces, and on November 12, 702, he distributed Taiho Ritsuryo to the provinces.

sen.j: 大宝律令の施行は、660年代の百済復興戦争での敗戦以降、積み重ねられてきた古代国家建設事業が一つの到達点に至ったことを表す古代史上の画期的な事件であった。
sen.e: The enforcement of Taiho Ritsuryo was an epoch-making event in the ancient history which showed that a project of constructing an ancient nation conducted repeatedly after the defeat in the war for the restoration of Baekje in the 660s reached one of the goals.

The enforcement of the Taiho Ritsuryo was an epoch-making event in the ancient history, which showed that a project of constructing an ancient nation which had been continued after the defeat in the war for the restoration of Baekje in the 660s, reached one of the goals.
sen.cmt: the, カンマ を補いました。conducted repeatedly→which had been continued と修正しました。
sen.e: The enforcement of the Taiho Ritsuryo was an epoch-making event in the ancient history, which showed that a project of constructing an ancient nation which had been continued after the defeat in the war for the restoration of Baekje in the 660s, reached one of the goals.

sen.j: 大宝律令において初めて日本国号が定められたとする説も唱えられている。
sen.e: A theory that a name of a country was specified as Japan in Taiho Ritsuryo for the first time has been advocated.
A theory that the name of the country was decided as Japan in Taiho Ritsuryo for the first time has been advocated.
A theory that the name of the country was decided as Japan in Taiho Ritsuryo for the first time has been advocated.

sen.j: 7世紀後半以降、百済の滅亡など緊迫する東アジアの国際情勢の中で、倭国は中央集権化を進めることで、政権を安定させ、国家としての独立を保とうとした。
sen.e: In and after the latter half of the seventh century, under tense international circumstances in East Asia such as fall of Baekje and so on, Wakoku (Japan) intended to stabilize the government and keep the independence as a nation by promoting the centralization.

In and after the latter half of the seventh century, under the tense international circumstances in East Asia such as the fall of Baekje and so on, Wakoku (Japan) intended to stabilize the government and keep the independence as a nation by promoting the centralization.

In and after the latter half of the seventh century, under the tense international circumstances in East Asia such as the fall of Baekje and so on, Wakoku (Japan) intended to stabilize the government and keep the independence as a nation by promoting the centralization.

sen.j: そのため、近江令、飛鳥浄御原令を制定するなど、当時の政権は、唐・朝鮮半島の統治制度を参照しながら、王土王民思想に基づく国家づくりを進めていった。
sen.e: Therefore, the government at that time promoted the national development based on Odo omin shiso (the thought that all the land and people belong to the emperor), through establishment of Omi-Ryo (Omi Administrative Code), Asukakiyomihararyo and so on, while referring to the governing system in Tang and Korean Peninsula.

Therefore, the government at that time promoted the national development based on Odo omin shiso (the thought that all the land and people belong to the emperor), through the establishment of Omi-Ryo (Omi Administrative Code), Asukakiyomihararyo and so on, while referring to the governing system in Tang and Korean Peninsula.

Therefore, the government at that time promoted the national development based on Odo omin shiso (the thought that all the land and people belong to the emperor), through the establishment of Omi-Ryo (Omi Administrative Code), Asukakiyomihararyo and so on, while referring to the governing system in Tang and Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: その集大成が大宝律令の完成であった。
sen.e: The final result was the completion of Taiho Ritsuryo.
The final result was the completion of Taiho Ritsuryo.
The final result was the completion of Taiho Ritsuryo.

sen.j: これにより、日本の律令制が成立したとされている。
sen.e: It is said that this event brought about the formation of Ritsuryo system (the system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.
It is said that this event brought about the formation of Ritsuryo system (the system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.
It is said that this event brought about the formation of Ritsuryo system (the system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan.

sen.j: 大宝律令による統治・支配は、当時の政権が支配していた領域（東北地方を除く本州、四国、九州の大部分）にほぼ一律的に及ぶこととなった。
sen.e: The governing and control under Taiho Ritsuryo almost equally extended to territories (most parts of Honshu (the main island of Japan) except for the Tohoku region, and most parts of Shikoku region and Kyushu region) controlled by the government at that time.

The governing and control under the Taiho Ritsuryo almost equally extended to the territories (most parts of Honshu [the main island of Japan] except for the Tohoku region, and most parts of Shikoku region and Kyushu region) that had been ruled by the government at that time.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。カッコ内のカッコを修正しました。controlled→that had been ruled と修正しました。
sen.e: The governing and control under the Taiho Ritsuryo almost equally extended to the territories (most parts of Honshu [the main island of Japan] except for the Tohoku region, and most parts of Shikoku region and Kyushu region) that had been ruled by the government at that time.

sen.j: 大宝律令は、日本の国情に合致した律令政治の実現を目指して編纂された。
sen.e: Taiho Ritsuryo was compiled aiming at the realization of government according to the Ritsuryo codes which conformed to the state of affairs in Japan.
Taiho Ritsuryo was compiled aiming at the realization of government according to the Ritsuryo codes which conformed to the state of affairs in Japan.
Taiho Ritsuryo was compiled aiming at the realization of government according to the Ritsuryo codes which conformed to the state of affairs in Japan.

sen.j: 刑法にあたる6巻の「律（りつ）」はほぼ唐律をそのまま導入しているが、現代の行政法および民法などにあたる11巻の「令（りょう）」は唐令に倣いつつも日本社会の実情に則して改変されている。
sen.e: 'Ritsu' consisting of six volumes which was equivalent to a criminal law followed Toritsu (codes in the Tang era) almost as it was, but 'Ryo' consisting of 11 volumes which was equivalent to a present-day administrative law and the Civil Code was compiled by amending Torei (codes in the Tang era) so as to conform to actual conditions of Japanese society while following it.

Ritsu' consisting of 6 volumes which was equivalent to a criminal law followed Toritsu (codes in the Tang era) almost as it was, but 'Ryo' consisting of 11 volumes which was equivalent to a present-day administrative law and the Civil Code was compiled by amending Torei (codes in the Tang era) so as to conform to actual conditions of Japanese society while following it.

Ritsu' consisting of 6 volumes which was equivalent to a criminal law followed Toritsu (codes in the Tang era) almost as it was, but 'Ryo' consisting of 11 volumes which was equivalent to a present-day administrative law and the Civil Code was compiled by amending Torei (codes in the Tang era) so as to conform to actual conditions of Japanese society while following it.

sen.j: この律令の制定によって、天皇を中心とし、日本の官制（太政官・神祇官の二官、中務省・式部省・治部省・民部省・大蔵省・刑部省・宮内省・兵部省の八省）の官僚機構を骨格に据えた本格的な中央集権統治体制が成立した。
sen.e: The establishment of these Ritsuryo codes brought about the formation of fully centralized governing system which centered on the emperor and set a bureaucratic organization of Japanese government-regulated organization or facility, etc. (Nikan of Dajokan (Grand Council of State) and Jingikan (department of worship), and Hassho (eight ministries and agencies) of Nakatsukasasho (Ministry of Central Affairs), Shikubusho (Ministry of Ceremonial), Jibusho (the Ministry of Civil Administration), Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs), Okurasho (Ministry of the Treasure), Gyobusho (Ministry of Justice), Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household) and Hyobusho (Ministry of Military)) as bone structure.

The establishment of these Ritsuryo codes brought about the formation of fully centralized governing system, which centered on the emperor and set a bureaucratic organization of Japanese government-regulated organization or facility, etc. (Nikan of Dajokan [Grand Council of State] and Jingikan [department of worship], and Hassho [eight ministries and agencies] of Nakatsukasasho [Ministry of Central Affairs], Shikubusho [Ministry of Ceremonial], Jibusho [the Ministry of Civil Administration], Minbusho [Ministry of Popular Affairs], Okurasho [Ministry of the Treasure], Gyobusho [Ministry of Justice], Kunaisho [Ministry of the Sovereign's Household] and Hyobusho [Ministry of Military]), as the bone structure.
sen.cmt: カンマ、the を補いました。カッコ内のカッコを修正しました。
sen.e: The establishment of these Ritsuryo codes brought about the formation of fully centralized governing system, which centered on the emperor and set a bureaucratic organization of Japanese government-regulated organization or facility, etc. (Nikan of Dajokan [Grand Council of State] and Jingikan [department of worship], and Hassho [eight ministries and agencies] of Nakatsukasasho [Ministry of Central Affairs], Shikubusho [Ministry of Ceremonial], Jibusho [the Ministry of Civil Administration], Minbusho [Ministry of Popular Affairs], Okurasho [Ministry of the Treasure], Gyobusho [Ministry of Justice], Kunaisho [Ministry of the Sovereign's Household] and Hyobusho [Ministry of Military]), as the bone structure.

sen.j: 役所で取り扱う文書には元号を使うこと、印鑑を押すこと、定められた形式に従って作成された文書以外は受理しないこと等々の、文書と手続きの形式を重視した文書主義が導入された。
sen.e: A document-based principle attaching importance to a format of documents and procedures was introduced, which gave regulations such as using only the era name in the documents handled by government offices, affixing a seal, accepting only the documents created in accordance with a predetermined format, and so on.

A document-based principle, attaching importance to the format of documents and procedures was introduced, which gave regulations such as using only the era name in the documents handled by government offices, affixing seals, accepting only the documents created in accordance with the predetermined format, and so on.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。a→the,a seal→seals と修正しました。
sen.e: A document-based principle, attaching importance to the format of documents and procedures was introduced, which gave regulations such as using only the era name in the documents handled by government offices, affixing seals, accepting only the documents created in accordance with the predetermined format, and so on.

sen.j: また古代日本の地方官制については、国・郡・里などの単位が定められていた。
sen.e: With respect to the local bureaucratic system in ancient Japan, a unit such as Koku (province), Gun (country), Ri (neighborhood) and so on was determined.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With respect to the local bureaucratic system in ancient Japan, those units including Koku (province), Gun (country), Ri (neighborhood) and so on were determined.
sen.cmt: a unit such as→those units including,was→were と修正しました。
sen.e: With respect to the local bureaucratic system in ancient Japan, those units including Koku (province), Gun (country), Ri (neighborhood) and so on were determined.

sen.j: 中央政府から派遣される国司には多大な権限を与える一方、地方豪族がその職を占めていた郡司にも一定の権限が認められていた。
sen.e: Kokushi (provincial governor) dispatched from the central government was given substantial authority, while Gunji (local magistrates) whose position was assumed by powerful local clans was also given a certain level of authority.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kokushi (provincial governor) dispatched from the central government were given substantial authority, while Gunji (local magistrates) whose position was occupied by powerful local clans were also given a certain level of authority.

Kokushi (provincial governor) dispatched from the central government were given substantial authority, while Gunji (local magistrates) whose position was occupied by powerful local clans were also given a certain level of authority.

sen.j: 大宝律令の原文は現存しておらず、一部が逸文として、令集解古記などの他文献に残存している。
sen.e: The original of Taiho Ritsuryo does not exist now, but partly remains in other literatures such as Ryono Shuge koki (ancient records compiled personal opinion of each clan which were comments on Yoro-ryo, Yoro Code) as itsubun (a composition previously existed but doesn't exist now).

The original of Taiho Ritsuryo does not exist now, but partly remains in other literature such as Ryono Shuge koki (ancient records compiled personal opinion of each clan which were comments on Yoro-ryo, Yoro Code) as itsubun (a composition previously existed but doesn't exist now).

The original of Taiho Ritsuryo does not exist now, but partly remains in other literature such as Ryono Shuge koki (ancient records compiled personal opinion of each clan which were comments on Yoro-ryo, Yoro Code) as itsubun (a composition previously existed but doesn't exist now).

sen.j: 757年に施行された養老律令はおおむね大宝律令を継承しているとされており、養老律令を元にして大宝律令の復元が行われている。
sen.e: It is believed that the Yoro Ritsuryo Code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) enforced in 757 generally followed the Taiho Ritsuryo, and the restoration of Taiho Ritsuryo is conducted based on the Yoro Ritsuryo Code.

It is believed that the Yoro Ritsuryo Code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) enforced in 757 mostly succeeded the Taiho Ritsuryo, and the restoration of Taiho Ritsuryo was conducted based on the Yoro Ritsuryo Code.
sen.cmt: generally followed→mostly succeeded,is→was と修正しました。
sen.e: It is believed that the Yoro Ritsuryo Code (code promulgated in the Yoro period) enforced in 757 mostly succeeded the Taiho Ritsuryo, and the restoration of Taiho Ritsuryo was conducted based on the Yoro Ritsuryo Code.

sen.j: 大宝令と養老令の編目の順序は異なっていたと考えられているが、大宝令の編目順序は明らかでない。
sen.e: It is considered that the order of chapter headings differed between the Taiho-ryo and the Yoro-ryo, but the order of chapter headings of Taiho-ryo is unclear.
sen.cmt: 編目→chapter heading[「編目とは、文章の編や章につける題目、またその表題の意味」（kotobank.jp より）なので]
sen.e: It is considered that, the order of the chapter headings differed between the Taiho-ryo and the Yoro-ryo, but the order of the chapter headings of the Taiho-ryo is unclear.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: It is considered that, the order of the chapter headings differed between the Taiho-ryo and the Yoro-ryo, but the order of the chapter headings of the Taiho-ryo is unclear.
